We should hire for potential. Instead, we hire for behavior.
It's time we started looking past the interview as the only criteria to base a hire on and see a candidate for true potential.
I just celebrated 2 years at Evernote and I've already learned so much. Here are a few things we sometimes forget:

1) Never underestimate the ability of a small group of people (users or employees) to change the world. From research labs to sales teams to authors and working parents, people have shown me that humans have an unbelievable capacity to do more ... with a little help from technology.

2) If it were easy, someone else would have done it. We're a different company than we were in 2015 with the strongest top and bottom line performance in history, adding billions of notes and a more streamlined experience than ever. Not everyone was betting on us, but people rally to a challenge.

3) I can do anything if I'm doing it with the right people. Thank you to my team for making this my dream job. I hope I can return the favor Francie Strong Michele Don Durbin Nate Fortin Erik Wrobel Chris O'Neill Michelle Wagner Vincent Toolan Jordan Hwang Anirban Kundu Forrest Bryant Monica Chua Jenn Choi Joshua Zerkel Lolitta Tracy
Is LinkedIn app buggy or is it just me?
The back arrow/button does not seem to work properly. Most of the time, I have to press it several times before it works.
Other times, it takes me to the wrong screen. I don't think I have the largest fingers, and I am on an iPhone :)

I am working as a Research Assistant for my Master's thesis in Computer Science / Mathematics - Statistics Department.Supervisor - Professor Carl Eckberg ( Department of Computer Science )Co-Supervisor - Dr. Samuel Shen ( Distinguished Professor - Department of Mathematics and Statistics )

As a freelancer iOS developer, my responsibilities are :-1. To understand client's requirements about the product.2. To suggest, pitch, develop best possible solutions with some enhancements in the features.3. To develop iOS mobile applications.

As Senior iOS developer of the company, my job responsibilities includes the following :-1. Responsible for designing the database schema for front-end.2. Responsible for creating the wireframes and the flow for the potential products.3. Responsible for Designing and building advanced applications for the iOS platform.4. Responsible for collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design and ship new features.5. Responsible for performing Unit-testing code for robustness, including edge.6. Responsible for identifying and correcting bottlenecks and fixing bugs.7. Responsible for assisting backend developer in creating JSON web services which are required for data parsing.8. Responsible for assisting the support team to provide seamless user experience for end users.9. Responsible for deploying the App and its updates to App Store.

As a professional iOS developer and one of the oldest member of the company, my job responsibilities includes the following :-1. Responsible for designing the database schema for front-end.2. Responsible for creating the wireframes and the flow for the potential products3. Responsible for assisting backend developer in creating JSON web services which is required for data parsing.4. Responsible for Designing and Developing the app in iOS with the help of major frameworks such as Core Data, UIKit, Core Graphics, Cocoa-touch, Core Animation.5. Responsible for Collaborating with team to define, design and ship new features.6. Responsible for Developing unit-test code for business, including edge cases, usability and general reliability.6. Responsible for Deploying the app and it's updates to App Store.7. Responsible for Managing team as a project lead.8. Responsible for assisting the support team to provide seamless user experience for end users.9. Responsible for providing assistance in evaluating and hiring other team members.

recommendations: Yogesh is an exceptionally talented person. He was the first person to join our startup when we were just trying to conceptualise the product. He came in and from word go he made the whole product his own journey. Right from helping in shaping the idea, to creating a design, to identifying resource requirements, to exploring all possible options for getting those resources, to inducting them into the team, to guiding them with details and in some case to the extent of even helping them with fixing their codes even though his own skill was iOS. His drive and focus is just amazing. And he makes sure that his outputs are just flawless. He has a long long way to go and I have no doubt in my mind that he will grow and do something great in life.
